channel.title: Logging in with Hyperion + 474 Client Help (Picture)
channel.description:
I can't seem to find what the problem is with me logging in. Obviously I've imported Hyperion into eclipse and having it running (Obviously to the point where it says READY). So now I need a client, correct? So I found [b]z474's Client[/b], Although, when I try to run it. This is the issue I get:
[IMG]http://i99.photobucket.com/albums/l283/Metal798_2006/Issue.png[/img]
Obviously the server is running. Most clients that you download are automatically set to either 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1? If I search the client folder for some serverip or something along those lines I don't find anything.
PS: When I tried running Hyperion on the Moparscape webclient, it worked fine.

item.title: Logging in with Hyperion + 474 Client Help (Picture)
item.dc:creator: @lolboy396 lolboy396
item.description:
@lolboy396 wrote:

I know how U Run server go on the connection tab click server type “127.0.0.1” Then Port “43594”

Read full topic
item.source: Logging in with Hyperion + 474 Client Help (Picture)

item.title: Logging in with Hyperion + 474 Client Help (Picture)
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

[quote=“Racist Turtle, post:3, topic:403373”][quote author=I am beast link=topic=500433.msg3659796#msg3659796 date=1310276856]
I don’t know the exact problem, although if you are changing clients, it could be a computer problem and or a server problem? Try restarting your computer or getting a new source. Other then that, I don’t know it.
[/quote]

Thanks for the help, but neither worked. Well, at least not restarting the computer worked. I’m not going to change sources (until I’ve exhausted all possibilities with trying to find a client for Hyperion), because as most of us know. Hyperion is the most stable base out there.[/quote]

Truth be told.

Read full topic
item.source: Logging in with Hyperion + 474 Client Help (Picture)

item.title: Logging in with Hyperion + 474 Client Help (Picture)
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

I am beast:

I don’t know the exact problem, although if you are changing clients, it could be a computer problem and or a server problem? Try restarting your computer or getting a new source. Other then that, I don’t know it.

Thanks for the help, but neither worked. Well, at least not restarting the computer worked. I’m not going to change sources (until I’ve exhausted all possibilities with trying to find a client for Hyperion), because as most of us know. Hyperion is the most stable base out there.

Read full topic
